description: A simple voltage detection module that uses a 5:1 voltage divider (30kΩ and 7.5kΩ resistors) to measure input voltages up to 25V and outputs an analog voltage (0–5V) suitable for Arduino analog inputs.
application_examples: Voltage level detection in embedded systems

specifications.interface: Analog output to Arduino analog input
other: Uses 30kΩ and 7.5kΩ resistors for a 5:1 voltage division
Output voltage is scaled to 0–5 V for Arduino compatibility

pins.VCC: High side of the voltage being measured (input)
pins.GND: Low side of the voltage being measured (ground)
pins.Data: S – analog output to Arduino analog input

getting_started.connection_guide: Connect the high side of the voltage to VCC, the low side to GND (common ground with Arduino). Connect the S pin to an Arduino analog input (e.g., A1). The + pin is not used.

example_code.explaination: The sketch reads the analog input, converts the ADC value to a voltage (0–5V), then scales it back to the original input voltage using the known resistor ratio. The result is printed to the serial monitor.

source_document: Voltage Detection Sensor Module 25V description and Arduino example sketch provided in the source text.
